##What can ordinary people do if they can't fight the pandemic?

WMSYGSDR

Function introduction, each line has the earnest person, again the ordinary person also has the extraordinary story. Huazhong University of Science and Technology Press Official non-fiction story platform, the story of the people will meet here.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
- In the event of an outbreak -

Only in such a special moment can we realize how wonderful and happy the ordinary days are..

”

- In the event of an outbreak -

Only in such a special moment can we realize how wonderful and happy the ordinary days are..

- In the event of an outbreak -

Only in such a special moment can we realize how wonderful and happy the ordinary days are..

”

The outbreak was so rapid that no one could have anticipated it.

On January 23,2020, I went to work on the last day before the start of the year. I was not yet aware of it. I saw a few people wearing masks on the road and did not care.

On the same day, Wuhan is closed to all traffic leaving Wuhan. This one"close a city"move is like a bombshell, set off a round of tremendous billows. The Internet boiled over with news, and panic and anxiety spread across the lines.

We are in a county deep in the mountains to the west of Hubei Province, in the autonomous prefecture of Ensch, next to the city of Wushan County, Chongqing in Mt. Wu, where confirmed cases have been reported. But the reality is still calm, people to and from work, walking, shopping. The closure of many street shops, which had seemed normal in previous years, now seemed to send an ominous message that people were becoming more cautious about what they said or did.

A colleague whispered to me, did you buy a mask? Knowing that I did not have a mask, my colleague reminded me anxiously: Hurry to buy it, there will be no more later.

Before I left work, my colleague gave me a disposable mask. It was such a common, cheap blue mask, but the situation suddenly gave it extraordinary value. In less than a day, the number of people wearing masks on the streets has increased significantly.

I walked into the first pharmacy, and it was deserted. I'm having second thoughts. Am I being too predictable? But before I could ask, the clerk at the drugstore volunteered: If you want to buy a mask, sorry, it's gone. I found a second one with "masks sold out" on the door, and a third and a fourth one as well.

To my surprise and regret, I found that masks, even the most common and cheapest disposable ones, were no longer available throughout the city.

On the bus home, usually crowded car today only half filled, everyone is talking about the Wuhan Epidemic, I do not know who issued a cough, frightening, even through the mask, can not help but breath. Back home, I know my daughter-in-law did not know where to buy some disposable masks, although not much, better than nothing.

The next day will be the Spring Festival, but the city is shrouded in the atmosphere of mountain rain, began to be called on the Internet, during the Spring Festival, we do not visit not new year.

This is bound to be a side is the noise and panic, side is calm and anxiety of the Spring Festival, but also in my life the most special of a Spring Festival.

On the eve of the Lunar New Year, my wife and I drove to my mother-in-law's house after lunch with my family. There were few pedestrians and the road was empty. It was like a lifetime ago when I thought about the streets, the crowds, the Kawa no Nagare no Yō Ni.

My mother-in-law's family lives in a rural area more than 10 kilometers from the county seat. The road in front of the gate is the main road connecting the county seat with the shanghai-lotus expressway. Before I came, I had made some rules with my daughter. I was not allowed to go on the street. I was not allowed to go to other people's House to play with children. And this year at Grandma's house to play only one day, do not visit New Year do not get together for dinner, the second day will go back.

Daughter complained about this year's "red envelope rainy day" is not not? I said my life is more important than my lucky money. Daughter is very obedient, only in the dark, went to the porch side to play a box of cannon, put a few fireworks, went into the house.

The Spring Festival gala of the Year of the rat has begun. I stared at my phone, switching between Wechat and Weibo, keeping up with the latest news of the epidemic, glancing up occasionally, the TV filled with song and dance, as distant as a mirage.

Brush before going to bed, the news about Wuhan is overwhelming, looking distressed, but do not know which is true, which is false. But on New Year's Eve, there are so medical personnel and soldiers to go to Wuhan overnight, also make me feel very comforting.

On the first day of the first lunar month in Gengzi year, the first thing I saw when I woke up in the early morning was the real-time dynamic of the epidemic situation. There were no firecrackers outside, no visitors. It's awfully quiet.

In the circle of friends began to see the county around the road also began to close the picture, I was surprised, and his wife discussed, worried about a little later back, will not go back, decided to leave immediately.

Traffic on the road was particularly heavy, with many Hubei a plates, and more cars from other counties and cities in Hubei and Chongqing, Zhejiang, Guangdong and other places heading towards the expressway entrance, but the expressway junction was reportedly closed, we don't know where they're headed.

I saw a group of people walking leisurely by the roadside, there are adults, more children, perhaps to relatives of the New Year, they are talking and laughing, do not wear masks.

In the market town, there are cars parked everywhere, women with babies standing on the roadside and chatting with the neighbors, many shops are normally open, a few elderly people sitting at the door, look peaceful. They're not wearing masks.

A village middle school gate, hung a certain year of Alumni Spring Festival homecoming celebration party banner, I do not know if the Party is successful? Or was it stopped?

Some people's door open, sitting in the hall table full of guests, the atmosphere is very lively. Of course, no one wears a mask.

It was not until near the county seat that many people began to wear masks.

We talked about it in the car. Didn't they see the news? Without a mask?

Maybe you can't get a mask in the country?

If not, TRY NOT TO GO OUT!

The severity of the epidemic in the countryside has not yet aroused people's alarm, but the countryside is not a paradise, the virus will not go around, not to mention so many people go home for the new year, really do not dare to think about.

Soon after, my Wife's colleagues reported that most of the roads from the county to the countryside had been closed, and that they had left a little later than we did, unable to pass, and had to stay in their hometown for the New Year. The city is deserted, no one can be seen, everyone is hiding at home.

Back at home, mom was cooking. We laughed and said that from now on we should save food, closed the city, do not know when to lift the ban, to store up food. Mom says it's fine. We've got plenty of cabbages and radishes.

In the afternoon, seeing that the traffic ban will be put into effect in the central city of Wuhan, I feel anxious for the people of Wuhan. Only in such a special moment can we realize how beautiful and happy the ordinary days are..

From the 1st to the 3rd day, the whole family stayed at home and didn't go anywhere. With the number of confirmed cases increasing day by day, even this county has finally seen its first case. Everyone is sitting at home, but the rumors like long feet, everywhere, seamless drilling, some people speak with conviction, a nearby community has a number of suspected infection, was forcibly isolated, the entire community is closed.

I asked a friend who lives in the neighborhood on Wechat. She said it was her sister who was quarantined, but the test results came back just a common cold. There is no such thing as a family being quarantined.

"This Spring Festival is very special. I believe that the government has the ability, not superstition, not rumors. " Every morning, from the window of the Propaganda Car Horn circulating anti-epidemic easy-to-read, will wake me up on time.

These days, although we can safely stay at home, many people still hold on to their posts, police, medical staff, and grass-roots cadres from 30 to now, have not had a day off. The unit informs us to go to work the time to postpone, the main person in charge has already sunk to the village grass-roots unit, participates in the fight epidemic front-line.

From urban to rural areas, the anti-epidemic publicity work has finally been launched without leaving any dead ends. Village community workers go door-to-door around the clock to screen people returning from Wuhan and register them.

Neither neither works in the town hospital, early every morning, she passes by our house to go to work, but I have never seen when she is off work pass by the door.

Comrade-in-arms girlfriend in the People's Hospital as a nurse, three consecutive days on duty three nights, last night at 10 o'clock, comrade-in-arms sent a friend's circle: she cried a while to sleep... zero to four o'clock, she is a hero.

Former colleagues who work at the police station told me that they now only have the most basic disposable masks as protection, and sometimes when a couple has a fight or something like that, they go to the police and climb the stairs to get Gasp, when he spoke through a mask could not help coughing, the caller looked nervous, said we do not quarrel, do not trouble you deal with, and then "Bang" to close the door.

He went on to say that from the 25th to today, more than people's auxiliary police have fallen in the front line of the epidemic, the youngest of whom is only 26 years old.

Hang up the phone, a moment of gloom, I can only silently in my heart from afar to wish all the police officers safe.

The county is now in urgent need of medical protection materials. The patrol special police have sent people to drive hundreds of kilometers to the neighboring cities to collect materials and make several round trips every day to solve the urgent problems of the medical staff and the citizens.

However, with the increase in confirmed and suspected sick leave, both county and township hospitals have experienced severe shortages of medical supplies. In Times of crisis, when all aid goes to Wuhan, the provincial capital, and the surrounding big cities, small towns like ours get little attention.

A cousin who runs a pet hospital gave more than 10,000 medical masks stored in the store to people nearby; a 51-year-old disabled person bought more than 6,000 catties of vegetables and preserved meat by himself and sent them to the canteen of the designated hospital without taking a sip of tea, some contacted fabric suppliers and garment factories to make their own protective clothing for medical staff; an old Chinese medicine doctor took the initiative to prepare Chinese medicine anti-flu preventive agents and distribute them to residents in surrounding communities free of charge; Many residents organized themselves to disinfect roads and public facilities around their communities with sprayers.

More volunteers on the move.

Three post-90s volunteers launched an online fund-raising campaign. They raised more than 20,000 yuan in a short period of time, but donations alone did not work. What they needed now was supplies. The volunteers finally contacted a mask factory with a small amount of stock, drove all night to the city where the factory was located, bought more than 20,000 masks, and returned all night to distribute the supplies to the people who needed them most.

There are countless other ordinary people who I don't know by name, who don't care if anyone knows. Here is our home, "clean self-improvement" slogan is not just shouting.

This is an invisible war, the main battlefield in Wuhan and the provinces and cities of the country, Small County and rural epidemic prevention and control in this campaign may be insignificant, but equally important. Thousands of miles of levees, destroyed by ant nests, invisible new coronaviruses, searching for every gap and loophole.

After the fifth day, the weather remained fine. Some people are not high vigilance began to bear bored, that the epidemic has passed, out of the head, around the movement, gathering. On a sunny day, who doesn't want to enjoy the sunshine and breeze in the countryside? However, this is a critical period for prevention and control, and the spread of the disease is still not to be underestimated, and every update of the data on the dynamics of the national epidemic is Psycho. The community has called in volunteers to help spread the word about the outbreak, and I signed up.

For the first time, people were given face masks when they loitered on the street but did not wear them. They were told to put them on and not to go out if they did not feel better, go to a stranger's house and disinfect their house. I was still awkward with my actions and my words, and I wasn't doing anything important, but ten million people were doing the same thing at the same time, working toward a common goal.

Flood in 1998, Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome in 2003, strong earthquake in 2008, our motherland has experienced many disasters, one disaster after another to rebuild, one after another to rise from the ashes, the fate of the country and the fate of hundreds of millions of ordinary people are closely linked, because the people are united, so will ultimately win.

With the development of information technology, the negative news about the new coronavirus epidemic spread all over the country, which filled the internet with shallow voices of criticism, criticism and malignity, anxiety, doubt and even anger can be felt across the screen.

And what can ordinary people like us do? Of course, we can only do what ordinary people should do, AH, love our family and neighbors, don't turn cold faces toward strangers, forge our ability to distinguish between right and wrong, and nurture our home with kindness and gratitude, in awe of nature and all life.

Don't stare at the shadows. Look up and you'll see the sun.

-EN

Image and text | Paederus, young author.
